My vote today ensures that the House can continue to move forward in a fair, professional manner that gives the public ‚Äî and the Nevadans I represent ‚Äî access to the truth of what has happened in the White House.
To be clear, today‚Äôs vote does not impeach the President. It allows the American people to hear directly from witnesses in the House investigation in an open setting.

The vote today allows the investigative inquiry to proceed in a manner that ensures public transparency, provides due process for the White House and allows for the Republican minority in the House to fully participate.

Today, I voted to honor my sworn oath to uphold the Constitution and to stand up for our democracy to formally investigate acts by the President of the United States. This is a solemn day and a vote I do not take without careful consideration.

Under an expansion of #Medicare coverage for dental, vision and hearing services in my district: 

‚ûï 97% of beneficiaries would gain dental benefits
‚ûï 79% of beneficiaries would gain vision benefits
‚ûï 80% of beneficiaries would gain hearing benefits

In 2016, a fifth of Medicare beneficiaries who used dental services spent more than $1,000 out of pocket. 

The #Medicare Dental Act would allow those seniors access to vital dental services as well as coverage for basic services (like dentures) and major treatment services.

One of those beneficiaries in Nevada is Barbara, a retiree who hasn't been able to see a dentist in eight years due to lack of benefits and cost.

In her own words: "My missing teeth right now are what are really embarrassing for me, so my self-esteem is in the basement.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/nrTsM0jygq

My legislation, the #Medicare Dental Act of 2019, would help to close this gap by investing in these vital benefits, providing dental care to 97 percent‚Äîroughly 122,100 people‚Äîof Medicare beneficiaries in my district.

A majority of #Medicare beneficiaries do not have access to any dental, vision, or hearing services through Medicare. 

This coverage gap has significant consequences on the health of our nation‚Äôs seniors.

The Health Providers Training Act would allow hospitals like Centennial Hills and Summerlin Hospitals to create opportunities for #Nevadans to learn the required skills to become a nurse, medical aide, home health aide, or a number of other much-needed health care positions.

This includes the #HealthProviders Training Act, which ensures that hospitals are considered an eligible entity to receive grant funds to train Temporary Assistance for Needy Families recipients and low-income individuals for positions in the healthcare field in high demand. pic.twitter.com/sJ9eBD1Hyg
